alert.note: Alert for Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 3:42AM CDT until May 06 at 7:42AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Oklahoma...Arkansas... Lee Creek near Van Buren affecting Crawford and Sequoyah Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lee Creek near Van Buren. * WHEN...From this evening to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 401.0 feet, water may begin to cover an access road into Tailwater Park. The recreational vehicle campground near Rena Road begins to be affected by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was estimated at 392.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 401.2 feet just after midnight tonight, then fall below flood stage. - Flood stage is 401.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
